high_impact_events.headline: The great graphics card shortage of 2020 (and 2021)
high_impact_events.summary: A significant shortage of NVIDIA graphics cards, particularly the RTX 30 series, affecting both desktop and laptop markets.
high_impact_events.rationale: The event has caused substantial price increases and long waiting times for consumers.

high_impact_events.headline: The NVIDIA GeForce CES 2021 Live Blog: Game On
high_impact_events.summary: NVIDIA's announcement of new graphics cards and technologies during the Consumer Electronics Show in January 2021.
high_impact_events.rationale: The event typically marks a significant release cycle for NVIDIA, influencing hardware sales and adoption.

medium_impact_events.headline: AMD patent teases GPU chiplet tech, the great big leap over NVIDIA?!
medium_impact_events.summary: An AMD patent suggests advancements in chiplet technology that could potentially outperform current NVIDIA GPUs.
medium_impact_events.rationale: While speculative, it raises questions about future product developments and competitive landscape.

medium_impact_events.headline: NVIDIA will no longer differentiate Max-Q and Max-P mobile GeForce graphics cards
medium_impact_events.summary: NVIDIA simplifying its mobile GPU offerings by removing the distinction between high-performance (Max-P) and entry-level (Max-Q) models.
medium_impact_events.rationale: This change could affect how manufacturers design products but is unlikely to significantly alter market dynamics.

medium_impact_events.headline: NVIDIA hints at RTX 30 laptop graphics launch on January 12th
medium_impact_events.summary: NVIDIA indicated plans for a new series of RTX 30 laptops, expected to be released in the near future.
medium_impact_events.rationale: This could lead to increased competition and potentially higher performance options for notebook users.
